titleStmt.title: An epitaph, or funerall inscription, vpon the godlie life and death of the right worshipfull Maister William Lambe Esquire founder of the new conduit in Holborne, &c. Deceased the one and twentith of April, and intumbed in S. Faiths Church vnder Povvles, the sixt of Maie next and immediatly follovving. Anno. 1580. Deuised by Abraham Fleming.
titleStmt.author: Fleming, Abraham, 1552?-1607.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Henrie Denham, for Thomas Turner, and are to be solde at his shop at Guild-hall gate,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "All flesh is grasse, the * Scripture saith, and vadeth [sic] like a flowre,".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
